title: I really hope Morde's VGU's more like Ryze/Taric and less like Sion
body:
Before you get your pitchforks ready and call me out for hating Sion's rework, which is absolutely not true in any stretch of the imagination, let me tell you why I think Mordekaiser would benefit more from a Ryze level update and less from a Sion level one;

In Sion's rework almost every single thing about the old Sion was SCRAPPED.
He lost the hyper carry play style, he lost his point and click stun, massive life steal and had a complete overhaul of his themes.
Old Sion was a champion that was nothing more but a cheap joke, no real cohesive theme, no strategic niche.
So he got just that, a complete reimagining of his character.
And it was bloody awesome.


Mordekaiser on the other hand does not have the fundamental flaws Sion had in the past and would be the perfect candidate for a Ryze/Taric level update?
Why you may ask?
Both Taric and Ryze had a core theme that was not only kept in their rework but also improved and fully fleshed out so that they truly live up to their thematics and lore.
They not only got new kits that were less binary and more satisfying to use but #retained their old kits in some way or form.
Taric still got his armor scaling, heal and stun, Ryze's combo and machine gun play style's still very much the same as before.
They got new tricks up their sleeve while also retaining much of what made them interesting and unique, something Mordekaiser's VGU should aim to accomplish.


As things currently stand Morde suffers from having great Lore and a solid thematic as the Dark Overlord Archetype, yet that theme doesn't translate very well into the game on a healthy level.
His Revenant Juggernaut theme on the other hand has a lot of interesting aspects that are currently present in his kit, in form of his unique drain mechanic that is his shield, it being very fitting for a Juggernaut type of champion.
His soul enslaving ultimate is also one of the core themes of his kit that should be retained in some way but made more healthy and easier to balance.

His play style as some heavy frontliner who thrives duking it out in the midst of the enemy team is already somewhat present in his kit in form of heavy AoE, his E's percentage shield mechanic and his obscene melee damage.

A rework should try to improve on this thematic, trying to retain the #Feel of his character while striving to improve upon his play style and themes.
He does not need a complete reimagining like sion or poppy but more of a solidifying of themes as was the goal of both Ryze and Taric's rework.

Just my two cents though, you're free to have your own opinion and share what you think about this topic^^

A few notes, old Sion was not *completely* scrapped:
- Sion can still stun with a fully charged Q.
-Sion retained his exploding shield, almost 100% like it was before his rework.
-Sion's permanent HP gaining passive on his old E was bundled into his new W.
-Sion's old ultimate  (barring the "heals everyone" part) is pretty much his after death passive.

Also, Taric is considered a Poppy/Sion level rework. Ryze is considered a Gangplank level rework.

I'm just scared that they're going to swap a lot of his cool current quotes for complete garbage non-combat related ones like they added to Ryze. Examples:
"Ah, Runeterrans. So endearing, so foolish."
"The wise seek to contain power."
"Blessing or curse, what's the difference?"
None of these have anything to do with the battle at hand. I picked these because they cannot even be ARGUABLY related to anything happening on summoners rift, they're just out of place and are only there to show us what Ryze thinks about sometimes- Something that probably shouldn't be done in-game. I don't want to hear these quotes in-game, ever. 

This problem, I shit you not, is THE reason I only played riven less than a handful of times in the past. "My spirit is not lost." Stfu you're on a battlefield talk about killing people. 

This is also why I adore Kled, even though he's not released yet. The voiceover has everything to do with what's happening on the battlefield, whether he's talking about killing the champ he's targetting, complaining that his companion abandoned him, or welcoming his companion back.

All that, and the VGU voice might not be the same and I don't like that kind of change.

Also, I'm not saying that all quotes from Riven and Ryze are bad. I'm saying there are several that I don't appreciate. The kind of quotes I would like would be, for example, something like Soraka saying "Hold on, I'm coming!" or something along those lines when her passive is boosting her. Combat-related.

"Ah, Runeterrans. So endearing, so foolish."
Ryze is talking about how he feels about other people. Summoners rift has at least nine other people so unless it's a full void team or something the line relates to summoner's rift.

"The wise seek to contain power."
Ryze is giving a reason he is on Summoner's Rift, he wants to contain power, the line is related to summoner's rift.

"Blessing or curse, what's the difference?"
Ryze is talking about how he feels having to kill people, who are the enemy team on summoner's rift unless he's playing ARAM or something, in order to contain power, the line is related to summoner's rift.

Of all the things that could ever potentially be a problem, having varied characterization and the gall to talk about things that are important to them has to be in dead last on the list. Riven's constant moping is annoying as hell, but it would be absolutely pitiful to lose the character's ability to talk about things that aren't literally happening right in front of them.

All three of those are REALLY stretching what he's saying to fit the bill. 
As for the first example, there are plenty of characters that aren't runeterran and aren't void, and minions are (not sure if canon anymore) automatons. He can say this while completely isolated. There is a VERY good chance the quote has nothing to do with anything. Once again- It's okay to give insight to how a character feels and how they see other characters or things, but it's both not realistic and not fitting for them to think about how stupid their enemies are while they're getting beaten to death or doing some complex maneuvers. 

What you said to the second example doesn't make sense, there's no power on summoner's rift (at least ever since the retcon, there's no canon power). The third is some extreme stretching and interpretation you did just to try and prove me wrong. Ryze doesn't deal in blessings or curses, thus there's no way that he could be referring to how he feels about killing people unless he's a riddletongue or lysdexic person.

Having the 'gall' to talk about things that are important to them is fine. But, as mentioned above, it makes no sense in terms of realism or thematic to talk or even think about such irrelevant things in the middle of combat. 

Assuming your very wild interpretations were true, there are plenty of other ways to say the same thing without having it sound completely irrelevant. Example: Instead of "The wise seek to contain power.", he'd say something along the lines of "I'm here to contain the energies in the area." Instead of "Ah, Runeterrans. So blah blah" it would be something like "Look at all these endearing, foolish enemies."

Ryze is smart but curt, he'd say something a way that's a lot less robotic. For the second one, read this quote you wrote before.
> He can say this while completely isolated.

Also that quote is too campy even for a saturday morning cartoon.

Overall, voice quotes like that aren't even slightly a problem. I really think you're just grasping for straws looking for something to complain about.

When I said "not void", I was specifically referring to the fact you said void didn't count as runeterra. I was saying there's even more non-runeterra that also isn't void (bard, sol) 

As for the only talking about the situation at hand, it's realistic. I guarantee you 100% no sane person will start talking about runes and travel and starting a campfire or whatever in an arena where 5 demigod-equivalent champions are trying to kill them or their things at all times. Makes them seem less robotic/one-dimensional? Sure. But it can be done better, much better.

The quotes I suggested aren't good, but that's why they're not paying me to write quotes. I was suggesting something *along those lines* because they make sense. Twist them some to make them really sound like Ryze, and you've got a superior quote. 

I stand by my opinion. If they add something like "The Shadow Isles will be mine" or "My bones remain safe" or anything along those lines to his VO I will be upset.
You'll be upset and everyone else won't even notice. It's amazing what people can do to themselves.
Look, if something's going to change, the change can't just be acceptable or ignorable, or unnoticed by most. It can't even just be good. It has to be perfection in every way.

So I definitely think this time around they'd be much better off just sticking with sololane Morde as a start and then solidifying his themes and fixing some of his abilities that are tuned for bottom lane.

If you refer to his OLDER iteration, a solid kit, then I can support that for a solidifying theme.

I know it sounds something similar to garen but to get that health back you actually have to put yourself in harms way to heal back up, it would make his passive more of a choice thing where you either: 1) Use that Shield to Block some incoming damage or  2) Let the shield Decay and regain some of the HP you have lost.
